author: Sophie McLaughlin
title: In pictures: Belfast Zoo animals take in the first snow of the year
text: In pictures: Belfast Zoo animals take in the first snow of the year Some were even out making snowballs! While they may not have to defrost their cars or worry about the heating bill, the residents of Belfast Zoo also are dealing with how to handle the cold weather. Belfast Zoo shared with us some snaps of their cold-loving animals making the most of the first snow on 2024 on Monday to cheer up this Blue Monday. A spokesperson for the zoo said: "The animals of Belfast Zoo woke to a winter wonderland this morning. "While many of the resident animals preferred to stay tucked up in their heated houses, some decided to have some fun in the elements. "Species such as the penguins and red pandas naturally thrive in such conditions. "However, others surprised their keepers with their willingness on getting out into the snow, such as the gorillas who took breakfast outside with silverback Gugas making snowballs for a treat." Check out the animals in the snow in our gallery below... (Photo credits: Belfast Zoo)

author: @wmbfnews
title: FIRST ALERT: Cool weekend ahead, Arctic air settles in next week
text:
FIRST ALERT: Cool weekend ahead, Arctic air settles in next week
MYRTLE BEACH, SC (WMBF) - We continue to look ahead to next week with the Arctic stretch of weather arriving. Until then, expect a cooler forecast into the weekend.
TODAY
Expect a few more clouds around this morning with a cold start as you step out the door. Fair weather clouds will give way to sunny skies and an unseasonably cool afternoon.
Temperatures should climb into the middle 50s today. Looking at the forecast as a whole, today is our second warmest day over the next ten days. Just to show the magnitude of the cold air expected next week.
A breeze will develop with an approaching cold front this afternoon and continue into the evening hours.
THIS WEEKEND
Another shot of cold air drops behind the cold front, keeping Saturday nice and cold. Morning temperatures in the upper 20s will only climb into the low-mid 40s by Saturday afternoon. Temperatures will fall into the middle and upper 20s Saturday night.
We’ll warm back up into the lower 50s by Sunday afternoon with increasing clouds through the afternoon on Sunday.
THE NEXT WEATHER MAKER
Our next cold front will deliver a round of quick-moving showers to start next week. Highs on Monday will be warm ahead of the cold front with temperatures in the lower 60s. We expect a breezy round of showers before the long stretch of colder weather settles in behind the system for next week.
ARCTIC AIR
We’ve been giving you the First Alert to the Arctic air next week for a while now.
Our confidence in the cold temperatures is high. Temperatures will struggle, only reaching the upper 30s to lower 40s through next week. Overnight lows will fall into the low-mid 20s by the end of the week. Our normal temperatures for this time of year should be in the upper 50s for perspective.
